snippet: Continuing an N.B.A. trend of teams firing coaches after successful seasons, the Golden State Warriors fired Mark Jackson, ending a three-year tenure in which the Warriors vaulted into one of the better, more entertaining teams in the league.
abstract: Golden State Warriors fire coach Mark Jackson, continuing NBA trend of firing coaches despite successful, 50-victory seasons; Warriors became one of the better, more entertaining teams in the league under Jackson's three-year tenure.
lead_paragraph: Continuing an N.B.A. trend of teams firing coaches after successful seasons, the Golden State Warriors fired Mark Jackson, ending a three-year tenure in which the Warriors vaulted into one of the better, more entertaining teams in the league.

headline.main: You Won 50 Games, Coach? Your Job Security’s Still Zero
headline.print_headline: You Won 50 Games, Coach? Your Job Security’s Still Zero
